means: 腓尼基（地中海东岸古国）

sentence.Network_en: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, went on board and set sail.
sentence.Network_cn: 遇见一只船,要往腓尼基去, 就上船起行.

sentence.Network_en: Europa was the daughter of Agenor, king of Phoenicia, son of the god Neptune.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧罗巴是阿革诺耳的女儿,阿革诺耳是尼普顿的儿子, 腓尼基的国王.

sentence.Network_en: The Saviour's visit to Phoenicia and the miracle there performed had a yet wider purpose.
sentence.Network_cn: 救主这次腓尼基之行,以及他在那里所行的神迹,还有更远大的宗旨.

means.word_mean: 1. an ancient maritime country (a collection of city states) at eastern end of the Mediterranean
